messageBody:
I used to extends testcase to run the preconfig my testcase, like
create the connection, clear testing DB, setup basic test data, etc.

After that, some online article recommend not to use inherience as it
make the testcase become inflexible, and the recommended approach is
to use testsetup to run the one time setup code
http://www.eli.sdsu.edu/java-SDSU/junit/faq/faq.htm#How%20do%20I%20run%20setup%20code%20only%20once

It is ok to clear testing DB and setup basic test data using this
approach, but how about create connection? I can setup a singletone
object which held a connection, but look ugly, any better approach?

Besides, for now I will overload runBare() to make all my testcase to
run against all supported databases to guareteen it work for all database:

public final void runBare() throws Throwable {
for (final Iterator/* <DataSource> */i =
DataSources.VALUES.iterator(); i.hasNext();) {
final DataSource dataSource = (DataSource) i.next();
this.currentContext = this.testContext(dataSource);
this.setUp();
try {
this.runTest();
} catch (final Throwable t) {
Logger.getLogger().log(Level.INFO, "dataSource: " + dataSource);
throw t;
} finally {
this.tearDown();
}
}
}

Is that any API in junit for me to do this kind of thing without
extends testcase?
